public class EchoFixPlayer extends net.minestom.server.entity.Player
A Player implementation that suppresses client-predicted metadata echoes.

The Problem

When a player performs an action (sneak, sprint, use item), the Minecraft client applies the state change locally for immediate visual feedback. The client then notifies the server, which updates its internal state and broadcasts the change to all viewers including the player who initiated it. When a player receives an update about themselves (the "echo"), the client reapplies the state, causing a visible stutter for one tick. This affects sneaking, sprinting, item use, and pose transitions.

The Fix

EchoFixPlayer intercepts outgoing metadata packets in sendPacketToViewersAndSelf(SendablePacket) and splits it into two copies. The copy sent to external viewers is always unchanged, and the copy sent to self is stripped of client-predicted (or otherwise preconfigured) entries. The filter is only active during processing of a client input packet (detected via the echoingSelfInput flag set in the method overrides).

Server-Driven Changes

When a plugin or the server itself needs to override a client-authoritative state (e.g., force a player to stop sneaking), use forceMetadata(Runnable) to bypass the filter: 
echoFixPlayer.forceMetadata(() -> player.setSneaking(false));

Elytra Handling

Elytra start (setFlyingWithElytra(true)) is predicted and filtered by default. Elytra stop (setFlyingWithElytra(false)) is a server decision (player landed) and always passes through to the client unfiltered (otherwise players get stuck flying and are unable to leave the pose, even upon removing their elytra).

Usage

Use this class instead of Player in your connection handler: 
ConnectionManager connectionManager = MinecraftServer.getConnectionManager();
connectionManager.setPlayerProvider(EchoFixPlayer::new);

    • forceMetadata

      public void forceMetadata(@NotNull @NotNull Runnable action)
      Execute a metadata change that bypasses the filter.

      Use this when the server needs to override client-predicted state. Without this wrapper, server calls to setSneaking(boolean), setSprinting(boolean), etc. will be filtered. 

      // Override the players local sneaking state
echoFixPlayer.forceMetadata(() -> player.setSneaking(false));
      Parameters:
      action - the metadata change bypassing the filter
